intro: Haplopappus prunelloides var. lanatus, commonly known as the woolly pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers that appear in late spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its hairy leaves and stems provide a unique texture, making it a distinctive species in its habitat. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
